name: Spit and polish
body:
Join us at Discord server: https://discord.gg/8mFhUPX  
Curated games: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/35328265-Powered-by-DOSBox/

# Boxtron

Boxtron is now installable using [Flatpak, Copr, or AUR](https://github.com/dreamer/boxtron#installation-from-repositories).

- Fix a bug preventing games using multiple CD images from starting - fixes e.g. [The Dame Was Loaded](https://store.steampowered.com/app/1006440/The_Dame_Was_Loaded/), and presumably other FMV titles.
- Tweak [Retro City Rampage 486](https://store.steampowered.com/app/204630/Retro_City_Rampage_DX/) to use `aspect=false`.
- Fix several bugs around parsing user-supplied regex for MIDI synthesiser detection.
- Fix bug preventing MIDI port detection if there are no soundfonts installed.
- Add several fallback soundfont names for various Linux distributions.
- Log paths searched for soundfont files.


# [dosbox-staging](https://github.com/dreamer/dosbox-staging)

The latest pre-release builds of dosbox-staging include multiple smaller and bigger improvements over stock DOSBox, several bugfixes, some new features, and overall better experience ([changelog](https://github.com/dreamer/dosbox-staging/compare/v0.75.0-pre%5E...master), [summary](https://github.com/dreamer/dosbox-staging#summary-of-differences-compared-to-upstream)).

Download [dosbox-staging 0.75.0-pre-392](https://github.com/dreamer/dosbox-staging/releases/download/v0.75.0-pre/dosbox-staging-linux-v0.75.0-pre-392-gf1f78.tar.xz).

To use it with Boxtron in Steam, update `[dosbox]` section of your `~/.config/boxtron.conf`:

    cmd = ~/<your-path>/dosbox-staging/dosbox

To use it outside of Steam Runtime, [install dependencies](https://github.com/dreamer/dosbox-staging#linux).

Have fun, and send us feedback :)

name: Speedy Staging
body:
Join us at Discord server: https://discord.gg/8mFhUPX
Curated games: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/35328265-Powered-by-DOSBox/

## Boxtron

- Makefile updated to support system-wide install (system-wide installation only available in Steam Beta client at the moment). Boxtron can now be properly  packaged in distro repositories.
- Improvements to CUE sheets handling (fixes e.g. music and video cutscenes in  [Carmageddon](https://store.steampowered.com/app/282010/Carmageddon_Max_Pack/) using software renderer - the game now runs perfectly when combined with **dosbox-staging** test build).
- Tweak for [Lords of Realm](https://store.steampowered.com/app/254920/).
- Documentation updates and other small fixes and cleanups.

## dosbox-staging (2nd test build)

*Users testing previous build confirmed, that it provides substantial improvements over stock DOSBox. Thank you to all testers! Let's keep the ball rolling…*

### How to use it

Download package ([link](https://github.com/dreamer/boxtron/releases/download/v0.5.3/dosbox-staging-2.tar.xz)) and unpack it somewhere.

Update `[dosbox]` section of your `~/.config/boxtron.conf`:

    cmd = ~/<your-path>/dosbox-staging-2/dosbox

### Changes

- Merged with upstream SVN trunk@4272
- Implementation of dynamic core for 64-bit systems by **jmarsh**, which *significantly* improves DOSBox performance on Linux
- Workaround for NVIDIA-specific OpenGL rendering bug by **Qbix**
- Updated version of **krcroft**'s audio patch
- Slight update to splash screen by me
- More compiler optimizations turned on, which *significantly* improves DOSBox performance compared to previous test build
- Various smaller fixes for type safety, removing memory leaks, addressing compiler warnings and static code analysis issues, etc.

Read more about [dosbox-staging](https://github.com/dreamer/dosbox-staging) project in [this Vogons thread](https://www.vogons.org/viewtopic.php?t=69497); source code for this release is on **po/boxtron-test-4** branch in dosbox-staging repo.

*Side note: this is the very first DOSBox build I tried, that runs [Stargunner](https://store.steampowered.com/app/358390/) at proper smooth 70FPS, as intended by developer in 1996; this is free-to-play game, check it out. :)*

name: Sating Box Dogs
body:
Join us at Discord server: https://discord.gg/8mFhUPX
Curated games: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/35328265-Powered-by-DOSBox/

### Boxtron changes

- Add an [option](https://github.com/dreamer/boxtron/wiki/Configuration#dosboxfullscreenmode) to disable games starting in fullscreen (with ♥ for tiling WM users)
- Include several workarounds for broken or non-portable .cue files bundled with the games
- Treat *.bat files as an executable for `BOXTRON_RUN_EXE`
- Prepare for initial GameHub support

To accompany this Boxtron release, I prepared an **experimental** DOSBox build from the [dosbox-staging](https://github.com/dreamer/dosbox-staging) repo. To test it, [download the package](https://luxtorpeda.gitlab.io/packages/dosbox-staging/dosbox-staging.tar.xz), unpack it somewhere and configure Boxtron to use it by changing/adding following line in `[dosbox]` section of your `~/.config/boxtron.conf`:

    cmd = ~/<your-path>/dosbox-staging/dosbox

You can confirm it's running by looking at the window title (it should say "DOSBox staging").

I would love to hear feedback from you about the quality of this build :)


### dosbox-staging changes

This version of DOSBox combines **krcroft**'s new audio for DOSBox patch to replace SDL_sound dependency with heavily trimmed **NY00123**'s SDL2 adaptation patch and additional changes from me to marry the two, rebased on top of the newest trunk of upstream SVN version.

You can find this work on `po/boxtron-test-1` branch in [dosbox-staging](https://github.com/dreamer/dosbox-staging) repo, but consider it very early and experimental state; *I do not recommend merging these changes to your DOSBox fork yet*.

Compared to DOSBox 0.74-3, this version has:

- Fixed input issues when playing in fullscreen
- Alt-tab working correctly
- Switching to fullscreen uses the display where window was located
- Fixed mp3 playback
- Improved ogg playback
- You can unlock mouse cursor when in fullscreen mode (Ctrl-F10)
- Steam Overlay seems to be more stable
- You can use Steam Overlay to allow cursor to leave game screen in fullscreen mode

Some games, that are significantly improved by using dosbox-staging:

- Tomb Raider 1 (software rendering)
- Carmageddon (software rendering)
- Alone in the Dark 3
- Megarace 2
- Stargunner


Known issues:

- Pressing Super to toggle Gnome Activities overview does not work
- New .cue parser is more strict, which might cause `imgmount` to fail for some games - happens e.g. in GOG version of MK3, and Steam version or vanilla TR1 (when running outside of Boxtron).

name: Right on .CUE
body:
Join us at Discord server: https://discord.gg/8mFhUPX

Highlighted changes:

- Detect broken case-sensitive paths inside .cue files (fixes [Descent 2](https://store.steampowered.com/app/273580/)).
- Use GUI (via Zenity) to indicate errors (e.g. when trying to start a non-DOS game).
- Change default `render.aspect` to `true` and disregard value picked by the publisher; in result number of game-specific tweaks went down. Users can still [override](https://github.com/dreamer/boxtron/wiki/Configuration#user-conf-file) `render.aspect` per-game.
- Filter out useless escape-carets from windows command line (fixes [Judge Dredd 95](https://store.steampowered.com/app/690250/)).
- Fix `mount`/`imgmount` commands using single quotes around paths.
- Fix crash on non-DOS games invoked through Sierra Launcher.
- Add several game-specific tweaks for DOS titles distributed without DOSBox.
- Prerequisite installation instructions are now less ambiguous.

Quick stats since previous release:

* [Curated games](https://store.steampowered.com/curator/35328265-Powered-by-DOSBox/): 157 (+4)
* [Tested games](https://github.com/dreamer/boxtron/wiki/Compatibility-reports): 79 (+6) (~92% Platinum)
* [Games with MIDI auto-setup](https://github.com/dreamer/boxtron#midi-auto-setup): 17 (+2)

name: Boxtron
body:
Join us at Discord server: https://discord.gg/8mFhUPX

This project will be called "**Boxtron**" from now on and is developed in parallel to [Luxtorpeda](https://github.com/dreamer/luxtorpeda), sharing the organization name, domain, etc.

After previous releases, I received some feedback indicating that users think this project is enabling support for games one-by-one (which is not the case). For this reason, from now on, I will rather do summary status updates instead of pointing out exactly which games improved. Please read the ["features"](https://github.com/dreamer/boxtron#features) section in README.md file if you want to know more about this tool :).

At the moment we know about [153 DOS titles](https://store.steampowered.com/curator/35328265-Powered-by-DOSBox/) on Steam, [73+ were tested](https://github.com/dreamer/boxtron/wiki/Compatibility-reports) (with slightly above 90% of games rated Platinum so far). Boxtron provides automatic MIDI support for [15 games](https://github.com/dreamer/boxtron#midi-auto-setup) (plus few, that can handle MIDI auto-detection on their own). It also fixes various problems in several more games (applies missing patches, brings back DOS support, etc.), making them playable out-of-the-box.

This release focused on internal changes dictated by the project rename:

* [Configuration file](https://github.com/dreamer/boxtron/wiki/Configuration) `steam-dos.conf` is automatically upgraded to a newer format and renamed to `boxtron.conf`, preserving user options inside.
* All [environment variables](https://github.com/dreamer/boxtron/wiki/Configuration#environment-and-configuration-variables) now use prefix `BOXTRON` instead of `SDOS`. Old names still work to preserve backwards-compatibility but are deprecated until future 1.0.0 release.
* Game configuration files are re-created and now use prefix `boxtron`. Content of some sections was moved to automatic configuration. As a consequence of these two changes, some of your games might now work faster, but your other DOSBox settings (e.g. scaler) might be set back to default.
* Logs now mention `boxtron` instead of `steam-dos`
* Code and documentation were updated to replace the project name.

name: Configure let MI DIs for you
body:
Join us at Discord server: https://discord.gg/8mFhUPX

Check our wiki for [compatibility reports](https://github.com/dreamer/steam-dos/wiki/Compatibility-reports) and follow [Powered by DOSBox](https://store.steampowered.com/curator/35328265-Powered-by-DOSBox/) curator on Steam! :)

+ Auto-detection of certain MIDI hardware setups to take precedence over starting software synthesiser; tested with Casio CTK-4200, Roland UM-ONE mk2, and Ensoniq AudioPCI.
+ User can now select MIDI sequencer by name, using `midi.use_sequencer` setting or `SDOS_USE_MIDI_SEQ` environment variable. More details in [configuration](https://github.com/dreamer/steam-dos/wiki/Configuration#midiuse_sequencer) article.
+ Look for soundfonts in `XDG_DATA_DIRS`
+ Prepare for flatpak packaging
+ Implement basic support for Windows batch variables (fixes Descent)
+ Implement forced tweak override for Sound Blaster port (fixes MegaRace)
+ Use official patch to fix broken music in [HeXen: Deathkings of the Dark Citadel](https://store.steampowered.com/app/2370/)
+ Improved Python 3.5 compatibility and other small improvements

name: Gib mi MIDI
body:
Join us at Discord server: https://discord.gg/8mFhUPX

This release introduces MIDI auto-configuration for selected titles:

* [STAR WARS™ - Dark Forces](https://store.steampowered.com/app/32400/)
* [X-COM: UFO Defense](https://store.steampowered.com/app/7760/)
* [X-COM: Terror From the Deep](https://store.steampowered.com/app/7650/)
* [Jagged Alliance Gold](https://store.steampowered.com/app/283270/)

Just click "Play" and enjoy glorious MIDI music, there's no need to hunt those pesky `SETSOUND.EXE` programs.

If you don't like MIDI music, then turn it off with `midi.enable = false` or `SDOS_NO_MIDI` and these games will be reconfigured back to use emulated Sound Blaster for music.

Other changes:

* `dosbox.bin` configuration option renamed to `dosbox.cmd` and now accepts full commands and not only paths.
* fix last-chance fallback for midi soundfont to `default.sf2`

name: Bugfix release
body:
This is a bugfix release.

* Dynamically load `libXinerama.so.1` instead of devel version of library (`*.so`). Prevents crash on systems without development version installed.

Join us at Discord server: https://discord.gg/8mFhUPX

name: New aspects for old games
body:
Join us at Discord server: https://discord.gg/8mFhUPX

* Sierra Launcher: now it's possible to select the specific game in the collection using `SDOS_SIERRA_GAME` environment variable. More about it in [readme](https://github.com/dreamer/steam-dos#sierra-launcher).
* Start [Tomb Raider](https://store.steampowered.com/app/224960/Tomb_Raider_I/) in software rendering mode - making the game playable by default (patches for GLide emulation did not make their way to upstream DOSBox yet).
* Slightly change handling of `render.aspect` preference in generated .conf files.
* Fix default `render.aspect` for [Ultimate Doom](https://store.steampowered.com/app/2280/Ultimate_Doom/) (other Doom titles have correct value supplied by publisher).
* Fix default `render.aspect` for [Dark Forces](https://store.steampowered.com/app/32400/STAR_WARS__Dark_Forces/).
* Fix default `render.aspect` for [King's Quest Collection](https://store.steampowered.com/app/10100/Kings_Quest_Collection/).
* Simplify version.py for packagers.

name: Multi-monitor support and Sierra love
body:
This release includes:

- Better support for multi-monitor setups - games now start in fullscreen on your primary screen and do not mess up screen resolution. User can select preferred screen in settings file.
- Reworked configuration file to enable users to effectively override dosbox settings (*warning: because of changes required for fullscreen support, game-specific conf files will be overwritten when upgrading from older versions of steam-dos*).
- User can now select preferred scaler in settings file. Default is `normal3x`, as it's safe, uncontroversial choice preventing excessive blurring in fullscreen.
- Initial support for games starting through Sierra Launcher - at the moment first game from launcher is started automatically.
- `render.aspect` is now picked based on settings prepared by game distributor.
- Bugfixes, unit tests, and changes in preparation for distro packages.

Also, Wiki pages with compatibility reports are waiting for your submissions ;) [Steam games](https://github.com/dreamer/steam-dos/wiki/Compatibility-reports),
[GOG games](https://github.com/dreamer/steam-dos/wiki/Compatibility-reports-(GOG)).

…aaand now there's a brand new Discord server: https://discord.gg/8mFhUPX

name: Bugfixes and improvements
body:
There are enough fixes in here to constitute a minor release, amongst others:

- Support for Python 3.5 (for Debian Stable, older Ubuntu and Mint)
- Ability to run different DOSBox builds (e.g. compiled from SVN)
- Bugfixes and improvements to mapping DOS paths to Linux
- Fix for Steam working-directory bugs preventing some games from starting
- Travis as secondary CI (primary CI is on [GitLab](https://gitlab.com/dreamer-tan/steam-dos/pipelines))
- More documentation!

It was also tested with a bunch of games - too many to bother listing here :) Thanks to all testers!

name: Improvements and initial GOG games importer
body:
This is a minor release with few important improvements, namely:

* Handling of simple .bat files - fixing games such as [Worms](https://store.steampowered.com/app/70640/Worms/)
* Improved handling of DOSBox arguments, which should bring support to most (all?) games from [3D Realms Classics](https://store.steampowered.com/publisher/3DREALMS/list/37610/) collection. Tested on [Stargunner](https://store.steampowered.com/app/358390/Stargunner/).
* Initial version of GOG games installer script, works best for DOS games that come with Windows installer on GOG. It unpacks a game to predetermined location (`~/.local/share/games/<game>`) without leaving Wine-generated files all over your home directory, then creates a .desktop file to simplify import to Steam library (bypassing all the Steam client bugs involved). Check it out: [link](https://github.com/dreamer/steam-dos/blob/master/install-gog-game)

name: Now with MIDI support
body:
Vesion 0.2 introduces:

* MIDI support (software synthesiser starts and stops automatically with the game)
* Rewritten .conf generator (more games running out of the box!)
* Support for steam-dos settings file (`~/.config/steam-dos.conf`)
* Ability to run arbitrary executable in game directory (example: `SDOS_RUN_EXE=Game/SETUP.EXE %command%`)

Some more titles working out-of-the-box with this version:

* [STAR WARS: X-Wing Special Edition](https://steamdb.info/app/354430/)
* [STAR WARS: TIE Fighter Special Edition](https://steamdb.info/app/355250/)
* [Jagged Alliance Gold](https://steamdb.info/app/283270/)

name: Steam Overlay support and more
body:
steam-dos now guess-creates it's own DOSBox .conf file, which allows for more games to run out-of-the-box. Defaults choosen for `sdl` section of that file are compatible with Steam Overlay.

Tested with 4 titles in [Doom Classic Complete](https://store.steampowered.com/sub/18397/) bundle and all games mentioned in 0.1.0 release.
